sourceMeaningMnemonic: <radical>Women</radical> who get together to talk about <radical>grain</radical>s are a <kanji>committee</kanji>. They're the Committee of Women for Grains (tm tm tm). What does this committee discuss, you wonder.
meaningInfo: Imagine what this committee of women could be coming together to discuss. Aren't grains just grains? Why do they need a whole committee?
readingMnemonic: Well, grains need a <kanji>committee</kanji> because the <reading>ea</reading>gles (<ja>い</ja>) have been eating them all. The women know this, so they're meeting and trying to come up with a way to stop these pesky eagles from eating all the grains and leaving none for the humans.
readingInfo: Imagine a committee of women standing together in a field of grain, watching eagles swooping around. They take notes and mutter to one another about their options.
